page.title: 01** MAYPOLES **
page.content: {**** Barwick in Elmet Maypole **** } The Maypole Festival is triennial. The maypole is taken down on Easter Tuesday, by the old fashioned way, using ropes and ladders. It is 85 feet tall and is repainted white with spiralling red and blue stripes. On top of the maypole is a fox weather vane which spins round in the wind. Halfway up there are four garlands which are made by different organisations from the village. They are made out of thousands of pieces of material, put into steel frames. The new maypole is put up on Spring Bank Holiday Tuesday after the festivities in the evening. It is carried down by hundreds of people shouldering it. When it is vertical again, a volunteer climbs up and spins the fox. {By Michael Edmonson. Aged 11. {Barwick Junior School.}
